title: Update global UI colors to light-blue background, white cards, dark headings, and yellow buttons

requirements.text: Update the app-wide theme tokens and global styles so the default (light) UI uses: main background #D6F0FF, sections/cards #FFFFFF, primary headings #2B2B2B, and primary buttons #FFE066 with dark text. Implement this by adjusting the CSS variables and base styles in frontend/src/index.css (replace the current neon/gradient token values and gradient body background).

quotes:
Please make my backround and things these colours.Main background: #D6F0FF (light blue)

Sections/cards: #FFFFFF

Primary headings: #2B2B2B

Buttons: #FFE066 (yellow) with dark text

acceptanceCriteria: On all pages, the overall page background renders as a solid #D6F0FF (not a purple/pink/blue gradient).

Components using Tailwind theme colors (e.g., bg-background, bg-card, text-foreground, text-primary-foreground) reflect the new palette: cards/sections appear white and default text is readable on white/light blue.
Primary headings (h1â€“h6, or at minimum the existing styled heading selectors) render with #2B2B2B and no neon-glow styling that changes their perceived color away from #2B2B2B.

requirements.text: Remove/replace the hardcoded gradient background wrapper in frontend/src/App.tsx (currently using "bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-100 via-pink-100 to-blue-100") so the top-level app container uses the global theme background (the new #D6F0FF background) consistently across all routes/pages.

quotes: Make focused changes only. Ensure no other features or CRUD is impacted.Please make my backround and things these colours.

acceptanceCriteria: The App-level wrapper no longer applies the purple/pink/blue gradient background classes.
Navigation between modules does not cause background color changes; the background remains #D6F0FF.

requirements.text: Update primary button styling to match the new theme: primary buttons render with background #FFE066 and dark text (use #2B2B2B or equivalent theme token), including hover/focus states that keep the button yellow and text dark (no neon glow/text-shadow that makes the text appear bright). Apply via theme tokens in frontend/src/index.css so existing button components inherit the new style without changing feature logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons that use the primary theme color display as yellow (#FFE066) with dark text.
Hover/focus states do not introduce neon glow/shadows that materially change the perceived button/text color away from yellow/dark text.
Button text remains readable and meets basic contrast expectations against the yellow background.

constraints: Make focused changes only; do not modify or break any existing features, data flows, or CRUD behavior.

Frontend immutable paths must not be edited (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Do not change backend code or schemas for this request.
nonGoals: No new pages, modules, games, or UI features.
No refactors unrelated to global theming (e.g., do not address known issues like localStorage BigInt/Principal serialization, Tailwind safelists, or LearnHub localStorage parsing).
No changes to authentication, approvals, admin tools, or any persistence logic.
